parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To remember, call to mind, recall, mention. A prolonged form of mnaomai; to remind, i.e. to recall to mind.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
One bound, a prisoner. From desmon; a captive.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From sun and deo; to bind with, i.e. be a fellow-prisoner.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: To treat evilly, hurt, torment. From a presumed compound of kakos and echo; to maltreat.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.
